<<<---

Are Web browsers really universal clients? (cont)

 --->>>
Page 6

Programming Web browsers now entails at least two languages:

  • HTML
  • CGI back-end

To handle more logic on the client, you also need to use at least one of:

  • JavaScript/VBScript
  • Java
  • C/C++ for applets/ActiveX controls

Who in their right mind wants to have to implement one program as pieces implemented in 3 or 4 languages?

Patrick J. Mueller (pmuellr@acm.org)
OOPSLA '96 Workshop on "Toward the integration of WWW and Distributed Object Technology"
